User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0.2pre) Gecko/20110430 SeaMonkey/2.1pre
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:5.0a2) Gecko/20110430 Firefox/5.0a2

Using Windows Classic theme, when the browser window is maximized and tabs get drawn in the window title-bar, a horizontal rule appears just below where the normal title-bar height ends:

http://i.imgur.com/4JMKs.png

It is more apparent using a single color title bar:

http://i.imgur.com/aq3Gx.png


Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Choose a Windows Classic theme;
2. Maximize the browser window;
3. Observe the title bar.


Actual Results:  
A blurry horizontal rule is seen just where the normal title-bar height ends.


Expected Results:  
There should be no horizontal rule in the "middle" of the title-bar.


Just after maximizing the window, performing a single click on the title-bar makes a solid horizontal line drawn over the whole title-bar including the tabs:

http://i.imgur.com/K4owl.png

Clicking away dismisses it.

All this is the same with Firefox 4, also.
comments.creator: stanio@yahoo.com
